flawed_nl_solution:
5% of $30 is (5/100)*30 = $<<(5/100)*30=3/2>>3/2
The dollar amount of Bob's discount is $3/2 so he will pay $30-$3/2 = $29
2% of $25 is (2/100)*$25 = $<<2/100*25=1/2>>1/2
The dollar amount of Kate's discount is $1/2 so she will pay $25-$1/2 = $<<25-1/2=49/2>>49/2
Altogether they will pay $29+$49/2 = $<<29+49/2=107/2>>107/2

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 57/2, not 29. It appears there was an off-by-one error in the fraction.
